chopper_ak47 wrote:
> I'm using NetBeans 4.1 with java JDK 1.5.0_06.  JUnit used to work,
> but now I'm getting an error stating that Junit.Framework does not
> exist. I didn't change anything in netbeans and I made sure that the
> junit library was added. It's visible under my libraries folder.
> However, I can't get any of my junit tests to compile.

There is no Junit.Framework...
...but there is junit.framework.

Maybe uppercase/lowercase is the problem.
